Articles.Content:
On a recent visit to Stonehenge, Buzz Alrdin...well see for yourselves:

![10424287_10153157212454581_1839882641419537165_n.jpg?oh=203c1cd461a6c37bec71c536e2baeb53&oe=558049A5&__gda__=1438184883_71437de8adf1c39f90ef1f3c7cdcb0cc](https://fbcdn-sphotos-f-a.akamaihd.net/hphotos-ak-xpa1/v/t1.0-9/10424287_10153157212454581_1839882641419537165_n.jpg?oh=203c1cd461a6c37bec71c536e2baeb53&oe=558049A5&__gda__=1438184883_71437de8adf1c39f90ef1f3c7cdcb0cc)

[Short article here](http://www.theverge.com/tldr/2015/3/16/8228623/buzz-aldrin-stonehenge-get-your-ass-to-mars)
GJ Buzz
It almost feel like he was going to fly to Mars himself, superman style.

Lets not forget this:

![BOID1.gif](http://i.imgur.com/BOID1.gif)

The time when he punched a Moon landing denier in the face. Buzz Aldrin, a true American hero.

> 
> Lets not forget this:
> [http://i.imgur.com/BOID1.gif](http://i.imgur.com/BOID1.gif)
> 
> The time when he punched a Moon landing denier in the face. Buzz Aldrin, a true American hero.

Thats awesome

> 
> Lets not forget this:
> [http://i.imgur.com/BOID1.gif](http://i.imgur.com/BOID1.gif)
> 
> The time when he punched a Moon landing denier in the face. Buzz Aldrin, a true American hero.

That was hilarious.

*"You're a liar and a coward and a- oof"*

Common sense dictates you shouldn't follow someone who landed on the moon/[U.S airforce command pilot](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Buzz_Aldrin), and yell at em for 3 minutes. *That's not a good idea.*

Also, you called him a coward, what did you expect would happen? ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

EDIT: If anyone is curious, video:

<iframe width="459" height="344" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/wptn5RE2I-k?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>
Buzz Aldrin= one of the best astronauts *EVER*

Hey Buzz!

If you're here, I wanna give you +Rep!
Love ya, Buzz!

> 
> Buzz Aldrin= one of the best astronauts *EVER*

Buzz's only problem was that he never got over the fact that he wasn't the first man to walk on the moon. Hey Buzz! You were the SECOND man to ever walk on the moon. Heck, you walked on the bloody moon! (And you've got a great right hook for an octogenarian!)
Anyone who's walked on the Moon is pretty special as far as I'm concerned.

> 
> Buzz's only problem was that he never got over the fact that he wasn't the first man to walk on the moon. Hey Buzz! You were the SECOND man to ever walk on the moon. Heck, you walked on the bloody moon! (And you've got a great right hook for an octogenarian!)

I agree. I actually stopped stating anything of first man to do this, second man to do this. Now, it is just he did this!

> 
> Buzz's only problem was that he never got over the fact that he wasn't the first man to walk on the moon. Hey Buzz! You were the SECOND man to ever walk on the moon. Heck, you walked on the bloody moon! (And you've got a great right hook for an octogenarian!)

What about [Michael Collins?](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michael_Collins_%28astronaut%29)He never even landed on the moon in the first place, just was in the command module (Though, one has to admit, being in space in the first place is pretty amazing, let alone in orbit around the freakin' moon)

Of course, he had all that time to himself,[that's pretty good, too.](http://what-if.xkcd.com/72/)
So many times over the years, I've wanted to grab that Total Recall clip, make 50 or so VHS tapes that just play it over and over again for 8 hours, and send the tapes to the NASA offices.

> 
> So many times over the years, I've wanted to grab that Total Recall clip, make 50 or so VHS tapes that just play it over and over again for 8 hours, and send the tapes to the NASA offices.

this one?

<iframe width="459" height="344" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/91dW9pUA1BI?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

> 
> this one?
> 
> <iframe width="459" height="344" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/91dW9pUA1BI?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

Precisely.
In 2004 I very briefly met and shook hands with Buzz Aldrin. I regard it as one of the high points of my life!

That picture and that video... both are awesome ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Although even if the guy wasn't a moon landing denier, the "you're a liar and a coward" was probably what pushed it over the line.
I love that guy. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

That Neil and Buzz both landed a tin can on the moon, done right the first time, with no reverts possible, is KSP on "iron man" mode ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> That Neil and Buzz both landed a tin can on the moon, done right the first time, with no reverts possible, is KSP on "iron man" mode ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

It's more impressive when you realize the LEM's walls were thinner than a tin can.

> 
> What about [Michael Collins?](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michael_Collins_%28astronaut%29)He never even landed on the moon in the first place, just was in the command module (Though, one has to admit, being in space in the first place is pretty amazing, let alone in orbit around the freakin' moon)
> Of course, he had all that time to himself,[that's pretty good, too.](http://what-if.xkcd.com/72/)

He floated in a tin can far above the moon... Planet Earth was blue and there was nothing he could do.

If any of you guys gets the reference, then congrats.

***All*** of the Apollo, Gemini, Mercury, Voskhod, Vostok, Soyuz, Mir, ISS, Shuttle, etc. astro/cosmo-nauts are awesome, just for the fact that it's space. SPACE. It's big, has no oxygen, can and most certainly will, kill you if you're not careful, etc. It takes true courage.

I get the reference!

Bowie!

What shirt was he wearing?
All astronauts have a badS flag firmly imprinted on their skin.

I am a bit disappointed you guys condone physical violence, anyone that chooses to continue or end a conversation that way loses instantly. Though I must admit the guy was annoying as anything and the impulse is very human. Guess astronauts are not super human either ![:rolleyes:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_rolleyes.gif)
